title: R45446
content: The Perkins Act, reauthorized as Perkins V in 2018, supports career and technical education programs at secondary and postsecondary levels. The provisions of Perkins V will go into effect on July 1, 2019, with the first year considered a transition period for states to submit plans. Perkins V authorizes appropriations for CTE programs from FY2019 to FY2024. The reauthorization process began in the House and was signed into law as P.L. 115-224. States can submit transition plans for the first year of implementation, followed by state plans for the authorization period. This report provides an overview of the primary differences in Perkins V provisions. Table 1 compares provisions in Perkins IV with new or revised provisions in Perkins V, highlighting significant differences in areas such as overall structure, funding levels, state and local funding formulas, accountability, and uses of funds. Table A-1 shows authorizations of appropriations for programs under Perkins V. The curr_chunk discusses improvement plan provisions, state and local uses of funds, national activities, general provisions, revised definitions, and new definitions.
